Key Match Events: Rahmanullah Gurbaz scored 84 runs in 45 balls
Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Danushka Gunathilaka shared a 32 run stand
Rashid Has the Last Laugh: Clean bowled Gunathilaka
Bhanuka Rajapaksa hit SIX against the spin
Rashid Khan gave away 17 runs in the last over
Mendis took on Rashid Khan and hit SIX
Mendis carves out a FOUR through the off side
Mendis hit SIX off Rashid Khan
Mendis and Nissanka put on 62 runs
Pre-Game Insights: Afghanistan had started their Asia Cup campaign on a convincing note after defeating Sri Lanka in the opening encounter by eight wickets
Afghanistan had the upper hand after scoring hundred in 12 overs
Sri Lanka produced a collective effort against Bangladesh and they have to emulate the same to outclass Mohammad Nabi and other Afghan players
Afghanistan had the pacers performing exceedingly well this tournament, they also have quality spinners in Rashid Khan, Mujeeb-ur-Rahman and skipper Nabi himself
Sri Lanka won the toss and opted to bowl against Afghanistan in the opening match of the Super Fours at Sharjah
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka beat Afghanistan by 4 wickets and five balls to spare to register a special win in the opening game of the Super Four stage
Sri Lanka opener were off to a flyer as they gave them a start of 62 runs
Bhanuka Rajapaksa and Danushka Gunathilaka guided their team in the middle over with the former launching himself over the Afghanistan bowlers
Miscellaneous Highlights: Afghanistan posted a stiff total of 175/6 in the 20 overs
Sri Lanka pulled things back in last five overs as they restricted Afghanistan to 175
Afghanistan's Rahmanullah Gurbaz was their top man as he went onto slam 84 runs in just 45 balls
Others: Sri Lanka Predicted Line-up: Danushka Gunathilaka, Pathum Nissanka, Kusal Mendis (wicketkeeper), Charith Asalanka, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Dasun Shanaka (captain), Chamika Karunaratne, Wanindu Hasaranga, Maheesh Theekshana, Asitha Fernando, Dilshan Madushanka

Afghanistan Predicted Line-up: Hazratullah Zazai, Rahmanullah Gurbaz (wicketkeeper), Ibrahim Zadran, Najibullah Zadran, Mohammad Nabi (captain), Karim Janat, Rashid Khan, Azmatullah Omarzai, Naveen-ul-Haq, Mujeeb Ur Rahman, Fazalhaq Farooqi
